Package fr.cnrs.iees.uit.space

Interface Sphere

All Superinterfaces:
Dimensioned
public interface Sphere extends Dimensioned

A generalised sphere in n-dimensional space (also called n-sphere). Basically, it represents a set of points within a constant distance of a central point. Immutable.

    • size

      double size()

      Compute the length / surface / volume / hypervolume (according to dimension) of this sphere.

      WARNING: works for dimension <4 only. Here is the reason why.

      Returns:
      the size of the sphere for dimension <4 - throws an Exception for dimension >3

    • contains

      default boolean contains​(Point p)
      Test for wide containement, i.e. a point lying on the perimeter is considered inside the sphere.
      Parameters:
      p - a point to test for falling inside the sphere
      Returns:
      true if the point is contained in the sphere

    • contains

      default boolean contains​(Box b)
      Test if a box is fully contained in this sphere (wide containment, cf. contains(Point)). *
      Parameters:
      b - a box to test for being fully contained in the sphere
      Returns:
      true if the point is contained in the sphere

    • overlaps

      default boolean overlaps​(Sphere s)
      Test for overlapping with another sphere. This is not strict overlapping, i.e. two tangent spheres (sharing only one point of their perimeter) will be considered overlapping.
      Parameters:
      s - another Sphere to test for overlap with this one
      Returns:
      true if the two Spheres overlap

    • overlaps

      default boolean overlaps​(Box b)

      Test for overlapping with a box.

      WARNING: this method is unfinished! do not use.

      Parameters:
      b - a Box to test for overlap with this one
      Returns:
      true if this Sphere overlaps the Box
